doc.previous: Along with the rest of Trafford, Stretford maintains a selective education system assessed by the Eleven Plus examination.
doc.after: The proportion of pupils leaving Stretford Grammar School with five or more GCSEs at grades A*âC in 2006, was 98.3%, compared to an average of 66.7% for all secondary schools in Trafford and a national UK average of 61.3%.[100] More than half of the school's pupils are from minority ethnic backgrounds, and approximately a quarter of all pupils have a first language other than English, significantly above the national average.[101] Stretford Grammar was awarded specialist Science College status in September 2005. The school was assessed as "satisfactory" in its March 2006 Ofsted report.[101]
